dt: {bc}a fine continuous protein fiber produced by various insect larvae usually for cocoons
{bc}a lustrous tough elastic fiber produced by {a_link|silkworms} and used for textiles
{bc}thread, yarn, or fabric made from silk filaments
{bc}a distinctive silk gown worn by a King's or Queen's Counsel
{bc}the colored cap and blouse of a jockey or harness horse driver made in the registered racing color of the employing stable
{bc}the styles of an ear of corn

et: Middle English, from Old English {it}seolc, sioluc{/it}, probably ultimately from Greek {it}sērikos{/it} silken {ma}{mat|sericeous|}{/ma}
shortdef: a fine continuous protein fiber produced by various insect larvae usually for cocoons; especially : a lustrous tough elastic fiber produced by silkworms and used for textiles
thread, yarn, or fabric made from silk filaments

dt: {bc}the silky or cottony covering of seeds of various silk-cotton trees

shortdef: the silky or cottony covering of seeds of various silk-cotton trees; especially : kapok

dt: {bc}any of various tropical trees (family Bombacaceae, the silk-cotton family) with palmate leaves and large fruits with the seeds enveloped by silk cotton

shortdef: any of various tropical trees (family Bombacaceae, the silk-cotton family) with palmate leaves and large fruits with the seeds enveloped by silk cotton; especially : kapok

dt: {bc}a gland that produces a viscid fluid which is extruded in filaments and hardens into silk on exposure to air: such as
{bc}either of a pair of greatly enlarged and modified salivary glands of an insect larva that produce a compound filament from which a larval or pupal cover (such as a cocoon) is spun
{bc}any of two or more abdominal glands of a spider that open through spinnerets and produce a filament used chiefly in the spinning of webs

shortdef: a gland that produces a viscid fluid which is extruded in filaments and hardens into silk on exposure to air: such as
either of a pair of greatly enlarged and modified salivary glands of an insect larva that produce a compound filament from which a larval or pupal cover (such as a cocoon) is spun
any of two or more abdominal glands of a spider that open through spinnerets and produce a filament used chiefly in the spinning of webs

dt: {bc}a hat with a tall cylindrical crown and a silk-plush finish worn by men as a dress hat

shortdef: a hat with a tall cylindrical crown and a silk-plush finish worn by men as a dress hat

dt: {bc}one (such as the cecropia moth) that produces a cocoon of silk

shortdef: saturniid; especially : one (such as the cecropia moth) that produces a cocoon of silk

dt: {bc}any of various Australian timber trees (especially genus {it}Grevillea{/it}) of the protea family that have mottled wood used in cabinetmaking and veneering

shortdef: any of various Australian timber trees (especially genus Grevillea) of the protea family that have mottled wood used in cabinetmaking and veneering —called also silky oak

dt: {bc}a stencil process in which coloring matter is forced onto the material to be printed through the meshes of a silk or organdy screen so prepared as to have pervious printing areas and impervious nonprinting areas

shortdef: a stencil process in which coloring matter is forced onto the material to be printed through the meshes of a silk or organdy screen so prepared as to have pervious printing areas and impervious nonprinting areas; also : a print made by this process

dt: {bc}of or relating to the American Federalist party

shortdef: of or relating to the American Federalist party
